r.t: Start of Block: Default Question Block (119 Questions)
1 WAMA_RADIO_1 - In the last working week, did you work at a tip/landfill or waste transfer station?
1A1 WAMA_RADIO_1A1 - In the last working week, did you work at the tip face or pit?
1A2 WAMA_RADIO_1A2 - In the last working week, did you work at a specifically designated asbestos disposal facility?
2 WAMA_RADIO_2 - In the last working week, did you become involved in transporting asbestos-containing building or demolition waste?
2A1 WAMA_CHECK_2A1 - In the last working week, did you do any of the following?
WAMA_2A1A I drove trucks containing waste asbestos materials (1)
WAMA_2A1B I loaded/unloaded waste asbestos building materials (2)
WAMA_2A1C Other asbestos contact, please specify [Freetext] (3) ________________________________________________
If 2A1 = WAMA_2A1B I loaded/unloaded waste asbestos building materials
2A1B1 WAMA_RADIO_2A1B1 - Were the asbestos containing products you worked with wrapped (double bag, sealed)?
2A1B1B1 WAMA_CHECK_2A1B1B1 - Were the waste asbestos materials you worked with friable or non-friable?
WAMA_2A1B1B1A Friable (e.g., pipe lagging, insulation, or flaking off from a surface) (1)
If 2A1B1B1 = WAMA_2A1B1B1B Non-friable (e.g,, asbestos cement sheeting)
2A1B1B1B1 WAMA_CHECK_2A1B1B1B1 - In what condition was the non-friable asbestos material you worked with?
WAMA_2A1B1B1B1A Good (where you could not see loose fibres and dust) (1)
WAMA_2A1B1B1B1B Poor (where you could see loose fibres and dust) (2)
2A1B1B2 WAMA_RADIO_2A1B1B2 - In the last working week, did you wear respiratory protection when you loaded/unloaded asbestos containing products?
2A1B1B2A1 WAMA_CHECK_2A1B1B2A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
WAMA_2A1B1B2A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
WAMA_2A1B1B2A1B Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (2)
WAMA_2A1B1B2A1C A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (3)
2A1B1B3 WAMA_RADIO_2A1B1B3 - In the last working week, did you wear protective clothing when you loaded and/or unloaded asbestos containing products?
2A1B1B3A1 WAMA_RADIO_2A1B1B3A1 - In the last working week, what protective clothing did you wear when removing asbestos containing materials?
3 WAMA_RADIO_3 - In the last working week, did you recycle electronics (e-waste)?
1 WAMA_aCTW_RADIO_4_1 - In the last working week, did you chop, cut, saw, sand or otherwise work with wood?
1A1 WAMA_aCTW_RADIO_4_1A1 - In the last working week, did you use power tools to work with wood?
1A2 WAMA_aCTW_RADIO_4_1A2 - In the last working week, did you work with plywood, particle board, marine ply or MDF board?
1A4 WAMA_aCTW_CHECK_4_1A4 - In the last working week, did you work indoors or outdoors?
1A4A1 WAMA_aCTW_CHECK_4_1A4A1 - Was there a ventilation system that removed dust or fume from where you worked in the last working week (local exhaust ventilation or on-tool extraction)?
1A5 WAMA_aCTW_RADIO_4_1A5 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protection when working with wood?
1A5A1 WAMA_aCTW_CHECK_4_1A5A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
aCTW_1A5A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
aCTW_1A5A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (3)
aCTW_1A5A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (4)
1A6 WAMA_aCTW_CHECK_4_1A6 - How was the working area cleaned of dust?
aCTW_1A6B Using vacuum cleaner fitted with a HEPA filter (2)
aCTW_1A6D Using a brush or sweeping the area with a broom (4)
aCTW_1A6E Mopping the area with water (5)
aCTW_1A6G The working area was not cleaned of dust (7)
1A7 WAMA_aCTW_RADIO_4_1A7 - In the last working week, was water spray or water suppression used to reduce the amount of dust in your work area?

1 WAMA_aFPE_RADIO_5_1 - In the last working week, did you use or repair any fuel-powered equipment other than vehicles or generators (e.g., concrete cutter, metal cutter, truck mount, chainsaws, lawnmowers, concrete mixer, brush cutter)?
1A1 WAMA_aFPE_CHECK_5_1A1 - What type of fuel was used in the equipment (other than vehicles) you used or repaired?
aFPE_1A1C Propane or Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) (3)
1A2 WAMA_aFPE_RADIO_5_1A2 - Were you indoors when you were using or repairing the equipment?
1A2A1 WAMA_aFPE_CHECK_5_1A2A1 - How was the area where you worked ventilated?
aFPE_1A2A1A By local exhaust ventilation which captured the vapour, dust, fume at the emission point (1)
aFPE_1A2A1B By on-tool extraction to remove dust and fumes away from your face (2)
aFPE_1A2A1C By a general ventilation system (3)
aFPE_1A2A1D By fans in the window or doorway (4)
aFPE_1A2A1E By open doors or windows (5)
aFPE_1A2A1F No ventilation was applied to the area (6)
1A3 WAMA_aFPE_RADIO_5_1A3 - In the last working week, did you refuel the equipment?
7 WAMA_RADIO_7 - In the last working week, did you collect/cut metal?
1 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1 - In the last working week, did you weld, torch, braze, cut, or laser metals?
1A1 WAMA_aWEL_CHECK_7A1_1A1 - What types of welding, cutting, or brazing did you do?
aWEL_1A1A Shielded metal arc, stick or manual arc, flux core (1)
aWEL_1A1C MIG/ gas metal arc, TIG/tungsten arc, plasma arc (3)
1A2 WAMA_aWEL_CHECK_7A1_1A2 - What metals did you weld, cut, or braze?
aWEL_1A2E Hard metal alloys (e.g., Tungsten carbide or Stellite) (5)
1A2F1 WAMA_aWEL_CHECK_7A1_1A2F1 - In the last working week, did you weld any of the following types of iron or steel?
aWEL_1A2F1E Mild, ordinary, or construction steel (5)
1A4 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A4 - In the last working week, did you grind welds?
1A5 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A5 - In the last working week, did you use a welding helmet that has a separate air supply attached?
1A5B1 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A5B1 - In the last working week, did you use a welding booth, exhaust hood or use local exhaust ventilation when welding, brazing or cutting?
1A5B2 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A5B2 - In the last working week, did you mostly weld in confined spaces?
1A5B3 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A5B3 - In the last working week, did you wear welding goggles, a welding helmet that includes goggles, or a welding shield when welding, brazing or cutting?
1A6 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A6 - In the last working week, did you wear clothing that completely covered your skin whilst welding (i.e., long pants, long shirt, overalls, gloves etc.)?
1A7 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A7 - Were there other welders working in the area where you worked?
1A7A1 WAMA_aWEL_RADIO_7A1_1A7A1 - How many other welders were there in the area where you worked?
1 WAMA_aCTO_RADIO_7A2_1 - In the last working week, did you use cutting or cooling oils?
1A1 WAMA_aCTO_CHECK_7A2_1A1 - What types of cutting or cooling oils did you use? (May also be referred to as lubricating or machine oils or fluids.)
aCTO_1A1A Straight cutting oils (clear and feels oily) (1)
aCTO_1A1B Soluble cutting oils (milky white and feels watery) (2)
aCTO_1A1C Semi-synthetic cutting oils (forms a semi-transparent fluid when mixed with water) (3)
aCTO_1A1D Synthetic oils which are water soluble (forms a clear fluid when mixed with water) (4)
1A2 WAMA_aCTO_CHECK_7A2_1A2 - In the last working week, did you use cutting or cooling oils with hand tools or with a fixed machine?
1A2B1 WAMA_aCTO_RADIO_7A2_1A2B1 - In the last working week, did you use an enclosed machine (you had to open a door on the machine to see the machining fluid)?
1A2B1B1 WAMA_aCTO_RADIO_7A2_1A2B1B1 - Did you allow time for the mist or droplets to settle before opening the machine?
_aPES_RADIO_8_1 - In the last twelve months, did you come in contact with herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, rodenticides, or fumigants?
_aPES_RADIO_8_1A1 - In the last working week, did you mix, load or apply any herbicides, weed killers or insecticides?
_aPES_RADIO_8_1A1A1 - In the last working week, did you mix herbicides, weed killers or insecticides with petrol?
aPES_RADIO_8_1A1A2 - In the last working week, did you use herbicides or insecticides containing ethylene oxide?
_aPES_CHECK_8_1A1A3 - Where did you mix, load or apply any herbicides, weed killers or insecticides in the last working week?
aPES_1A1A3A1A By local exhaust ventilation which captured the vapour, dust, fume at the emission point (1)
aPES_1A1A3A1B By on-tool extraction to remove dust and fumes away from your face (2)
aPES_1A1A3A1C By a general ventilation system (3)
aPES_1A1A3A1D By fans in the window or doorway (4)
aPES_1A1A3A1E By open doors or windows (5)
aPES_1A1A3A1F No ventilation was applied to the area (6)
aPES_RADIO_8_1A1A4 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protection while mixing, loading or applying herbicides or insecticides?
_aPES_CHECK_8_1A1A4A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
aPES_1A1A4A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
aPES_1A1A4A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (3)
aPES_1A1A4A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (4)
aPES_RADIO_8_1A1A5 - In the last working week, what clothing did you wear when mixing or applying herbicides or insecticides?
aPES_1A1A5F Shirts or t-shirts with sleeves (6)
_aPES_RADIO_8_1A2 - In the last working week, did you apply fumigants to kill pests on stored crops?
_aPES_CHECK_8_1A2A1 - What fumigants did you apply or mix in the last working week?
_aPES_RADIO_8_1A2A2 - In the last working week, did you enter the area during fumigation and/or before the area was declared safe?
_aPES_RADIO_8_1A2A2A1 - Were you wearing an air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) when you entered the area?
_aPES_RADIO_8_1A2A3 - In the last working week, was the fumigation area always sealed from other areas?
1 WAMA_aDVM_RADIO_9_1 - In the last working week, did you drive, maintain, or travel in vehicles as part of your work?

aDVM_1A1C Liquified Petroleum Gas (LPG) or propane (3)

aDVM_1A3A1A Any public street or road in an urban area (1)
aDVM_1A3A1B National, regional, district or municipal roads outside an urban area (including motorways) (2)

1 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1 - In the last working week did you carry out any work that may have the risk of higher ionising radiation exposure or did you have to wear a real-time electronic dosimeter? INTERVIEWER: Higher ionising radiation exposure could be due to handling radiation sources or radioactive material including waste products, working near the reactor, emergency intervention.
1A1 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A1 - Did you use radio-protective garments (such as lead aprons, gloves, leaded glasses, whole protection suit) when conducting this work?

1A2 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A2 - In the last working week, did you wear an individual dosimetry badge when handling radioactive sources or radioactive materials including waste, working near the reactor or during an emergency intervention?
1A2A1 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A2A1 - Do you know the dose you had on your badge for the past year?
1A2A1A1 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A2A1A1 - What is the dose you had last year?
aENU_1A2A1A1A Less than 2 milisievert per year (1)
aENU_1A2A1A1B Between 2 millisievert and less than 6 millisievert per year (2)
aENU_1A2A1A1C Between 6 and less than 20 millisievert per year (3)
aENU_1A2A1A1D Equal to or more than 20 millisievert per year (4)
1A2A1B1 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A2A1B1 - In the last year, was there an investigation carried out by the national authority due to your individual dosimeter reading?
1A3 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A3 - In the last year, were you restricted to work because of excessive exposure to ionising radiation?
1A4 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A4 - In the last year, were you a victim of a radiation accident at work?
1A5 WAMA_aENU_RADIO_13_1A5 - In the last year, did you attend any workplace training on radiation protection?
1 WAMA_aCLH_RADIO_14_1 - In the last working week, did you clean your hands with anything other than water, soap, detergent, or antibacterial gel/spray at work?
1A1 WAMA_aCLH_CHECK_14_1A1 - In the last working week, did you use any of the following to clean your hands at work?
aCLH_1A1B Mineral turpentine, mineral spirits or white spirit or paint thinner (2)
1 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1 - In the last working week, did you work outside during the day (includes being in a vehicle that is outside)?

aUVR_1A3A Under partial shade (e.g., sun shade sail, under trees) (1)

1A3A1 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3A1 - How many hours per day did you spend working under partial shade?
If 1A3 = WAMA_aUVR_1A3A Under partial shade (e.g., sun shade sail, under trees)
1A3A2 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3A2 - In the last working week, did you wear clothing that covered most of your body (i.e., trousers and shirts or t-shirts with sleeves) when working under partial shade?
If 1A3 = WAMA_aUVR_1A3A Under partial shade (e.g., sun shade sail, under trees)
1A3A3 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3A3 - In the last working week, did you wear sunscreen when working under partial shade?
If 1A3 = WAMA_aUVR_1A3A Under partial shade (e.g., sun shade sail, under trees)
1A3A4 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3A4 - In the last working week did you wear a hat or other sun protection head cover when working out under partial shade?
1A3B1 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3B1 - In the last working week, how many hours per day did you spend working out in the open?
1A3B2 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3B2 - In the last working week, did you wear clothing that covered most of your body (i.e., trousers and shirts or t-shirts with sleeves) when working out in the open?
1A3B3 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3B3 - In the last working week, did you wear sunscreen when working out in the open?
1A3B4 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3B4 - In the last working week, did you wear a hat or other sun protection head cover when working out in the open?
1A3C1 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3C1 - In the last working week, did you have your windows open in the vehicle you were working in?
1A3C1A1 WAMA_aUVR_RADIO_15_1A3C1A1 - In the last working week, how many hours per day did you spend working in a vehicle with your windows down?
